instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Bad CPU_VIDSCLK
threads.message:
Hello,

I come today with this board with which I measured good values everywhere.
Only PPVCC_S0_CPU is not present

So I made the measurements of U7200 which should send to PPVCC_S0_CPU

CPU_VR_EN 0v OK
CPU_VIDSOUT 1.04v OK
CPU_VIDALERT_L 1.04v OK
CPU_VIDSCLK 0.365v INSTEAD OF 1.04V
CPUVR_ISUMP 0v INSTEAD OF 1.8V
CPUVR_ISUMN 0v INSTEAD OF 1.8V
CPUVR_ISEN1 0v INSTEAD OF 1.8V
CPUVR_ISEN2 0v INSTEAD OF 1.8V
CPU_VCCSENSE_P 0v INSTEAD OF 1.8V
CPU_VCCSENSE_N 0v OK

I replaced following the liquid damage U1900 and Q3080
Also catch-ups around the SMC

I don't have an oscilloscope unfortunately ...

thank you in advance for your help

threads.title: Bad CPU_VIDSCLK
threads.message:
"CPU_VR_EN 0v OK"
OK???
You made other bad assumptions too.
But get enable signal for CPU power supply first...

threads.title: Bad CPU_VIDSCLK
threads.message:
OK, that also seemed strange to me but it was the measure of a functional board ...
I will keep you informed
